verses.verse: The beginning of the good news of Jesus, the Anointed King, God's Son,
as it has been written in the Preachers, (in Isaiah 40:3) "Look, I am sending My announcer out on a mission before Your face, who will design Your road in front of You.
A voice shouting in the backcountry, 'Get the road of the Master ready. Make His paths straight.'"
John became submerging people in the backcountry and speaking publicly about a change of ways submersion for forgiveness of sins.
And all Judea (a rural area) and the Jerusalemites were traveling out to him, and everyone was being submerged in the Jordan River by him acknowledging their sins out loud.
John was a person who had put on camel hair and a leather sash around his waist and was eating grasshoppers and wild honey.
And he was speaking publicly, saying, "The One stronger than me is coming behind me of whom I am not sufficient, after stooping, to release the strap of His sandals.
I certainly submerged you in water, but He will submerge you in the Sacred Spirit.
And it happened in those days; Jesus came out of Nazareth, Galilee and was submerged by John in the Jordan River.
And right away as He stepped up out of the water, He saw the skies being split and the Spirit as if It were a dove stepping down on Him.
And a voice happened from the heavens, "You are My Son, the loved Son, in whom I am pleased."
And right away the Spirit threw Him out into the backcountry.
And He was there in the backcountry forty days experiencing trouble under the Opponent. And He was with the wild animals, and the angels were serving Him.
After the time for John to be turned in, Jesus went into Galilee speaking publicly about the good news of the empire of God
and saying, "The appointed time has been accomplished, and the empire of God has come near. Change your ways, and trust in the good news."
As He was traipsing around along the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew (his brother), throwing a throw net in the sea. You see, they were fishermen.
And Jesus said to them, "Come on behind Me, and I will make you to become fishermen of people."
And right away after leaving their nets, they followed Him.
After He walked on from there for a little while, He saw James (the son of Zebedee) and John (his brother), as they were also developing the nets in the boat.
And right away He invited them. And after they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired workers, they went off behind Him.
And they travel into Capernaum, and right away on the Sabbaths, when He went into the synagogue, He was teaching.
And they were being impressed based on His teaching. You see, He was teaching them as a person having authority and not as the Old Testament transcribers.
And in their synagogue there was a person with a spirit that was not clean, and he yelled out,
saying, "Ahhhh! What is there between us and You, Jesus, Nazarene? Did You come to ruin us? I realize who You are, the Sacred One of God."
And Jesus forbid it, saying, "Be quiet, and come out of him."
And after the spirit that was not clean sent him into convulsions and yelled with a loud voice, He came out of him.

And everyone was bewildered in such a way to be posing questions to themselves, saying, "What is this thing? What is this new teaching? Because He even gives directives in line with authority to the spirits, the ones that are not clean, and they obey Him."
The hearsay about Him went out right away into the whole surrounding rural area of Galilee.
And right away after they went out of the synagogue, they went into the house of Simon and Andrew with James and John.
The mother-in-law of Simon was lying down having a fever. And right away they tell Him about her.
And when He came forward, He got her up after taking hold of her hand. And the fever left her right away, and she was serving them.
When it became evening after the sun set, they were bringing to Him all the people who had it bad, and the people who had demons.
And the whole city had come together in one place to the door.
And He healed many people who had it bad with various illnesses and threw out many demons. And He was not leaving the demons to be speaking because they knew Him.
And in the morning (very much in the night), after getting up, He went out, went off to an uninhabited place, and was praying there.
And Simon and the people with him hunted Him down,
and when they find Him, they say to Him, "Everyone is looking for You."
And He says to them, "We should lead into the next towns so that I might speak publicly there also. You see, for this I have come out.
And He was in their synagogues in all of Galilee speaking publicly and throwing out the demons.
And a skin-diseased man came to Him encouraging Him, kneeling to Him, and saying to Him, "If You want to, You are able to clear me up."
When Jesus had sympathy, after He put out the hand, He touched him and says to him, "I want to. Be cleared up."
And when He spoke, right away the skin disease went away from him, and he was cleared up.
And after being stern with him, He put him out right away.
And He says to him, "See, you shouldn't say anything to anyone. But go back. Show yourself to the priest, and offer up what Moses instructed concerning your cleansing for a witness to them."

But when the man went out, he began to be speaking publicly a lot and to be frequently commenting about the matter in such a way for Him to no longer be able to go into a city in a shown way. But He was outside in uninhabited places, and they were coming to Him from all directions.
